name: impatiently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 in a way that shows you are annoyed by someone's mistakes or because you have to wait: "Yes, you said that before," she said impatiently. He snapped impatiently when I suggested I help him with his homework.
in a way that shows you want something to happen as soon as possible: We were waiting impatiently for the show to begin . He started to glance impatiently at his watch. See
impatient
More examplesFewer examplesShe impatiently brushed off the question.He speaks proudly of his record and impatiently rejects the constant criticisms of his company.Drivers honk impatiently at men pulling ancient wooden carts piled high with mangoes and bananas.He fiddled impatiently with the football until it was his turn to show off his skills.
